Race.SpecificTitle: Village of Napoleonville -- 1/2% S&U Tax - M&BOA - Perp.
Race.FullText: Shall the Village of Napoleonville, State of Louisiana (the ''Village"), be authorized to levy and collect a tax of one-half of one percent (1/2%) (the "Tax") upon sale at retail, the use, the lease or rental, the consumption, and storage for use or consumption, of tangible personal property and on sales of services in the Village, all as defined by law (an estimated $57,500 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the Tax for an entire year), in perpetuity, commencing January 1, 2020, with the avails and proceeds of the Tax (after paying reasonable and necessary costs and expenses of collecting and administering the Tax) received by the Village to be used solely for the purposes of supporting the Village's Public Safety Department?

Race.SpecificTitle: Landry Subdivision Gravity Drainage District #7 -- $65 Parcel Fee - BOC - 15 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Landry Subdivision Gravity Drainage District #7 Proposition
(In-Lieu Parcel Fee)
Race.FullText: Shall the Landry Subdivision Gravity Drainage District #7 of the Parish of Assumption, Louisiana (the "District"), levy and collect an annual parcel fee of Sixty-Five Dollars ($65.00) on each lot, sub-divided portion of ground or individual tract located in the District upon which is located either in whole or in part, a residential or commercial structure, regardless of whether the structure is occupied or unoccupied, for a period of fifteen (15) years, beginning with the year 2020 and ending with the year 2034 (an estimated $104,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the parcel fee for an entire year), for the purpose of paying the cost of constructing and maintaining levees, levee drainage, flood protection, hurricane flood protection, and all purposes incidental thereto, including paying compensation for the exercise of permanent or temporary servitudes, and to pay debt obligations of the District issued for such purposes, said parcel fee to be in lieu of and replace a parcel fee of Fifty Dollars ($50) authorized to be levied in the District through the year 2021 at an election held in said District on November 7, 2006?
